column1: # French phrases mapped to English phrases

column2: addition e.g. l’addition et la soustraction: addition and subtraction

column3: tune e.g. Elle a l’air fatiguée: she looks tired

column1: aire (f): area (e.g. service area near a motorway)
ajouter: to add e.g. il ajoute du sel: he is adding some osalt
alimentaire: food (relating to food or eating or diet) # ignore translation error
apprendre: to learn (to teach: Elle m’apprend le français: she is teaching me French)
arroser: to water e.g. il a arrosé la plante: he watered the plant (past participle: arrosé)

column3: in the (contracted form of à le)

column1: autour de/du: around e.g. j’ai marché autour du lac: I walked around the lake

column2: campaign e.g. une campagne de marketing: a marketing campaign

column3: that (sometimes these e.g. ce sont; used before être

column2: cela/ça: this or that (when followed by verb other than être…; ça is spoken version of cela)

column1: centime (m): cent (hundreth part of euro) # ignore translation error

column4: fair e.g. bleu clair: light blue

column1: collègue: colleague (noun can be masculine of feminine)
commencer: to start (usually followed by à if verb)
connaitre: to know people or places (when you are familiar with someone or something)
conseiller: to advise (followed by de if verb follows)
coton (m): cotton e.g. son pantalon sont en coton: his pants are cotton
crème (m): white coffee e.g. un grand crème: a large espresso coffee with milk # ignore translation error

column3: punctured e.g. un pneu crevé: a flat tire # ignore translation error

column2: have a puncture # ignore translation error

column1: cuillère à café or une petite cuillère: teaspoon
degré: degree e.g. deux degrés Celsius
déjeuner (m): lunch; to have lunch e.g. petit déjeuner: breakfast

column2: for e.g. je nagé depuis une heure: I am swimming for an hour (and still swimming)

column1: deuxième: second e.g. second place in race

column5: indicates obligation or duty - used in personal obligation; whereas falloir more general)

column3: rub out (e.g. delete photo from camera)
series e.g. a show on TV # ignore translation error

column2: of them e.g. il en à dix: he has ten of them
be here e.g. je suis là: I am here

column4: it is necessary to (indicates a need or necessity - impersonal
column5: used in general obligation; whereas devoir more personal: focus on the action)

column1: foncé: dark e.g. bleu foncé: dark blue

column3: make e.g. il gagne un bon salaire: he earns good money (past participle: gagné)

column1: gare-toi ici: park here # ignore translation error
il y a trop de monde: there are too many people

column2: news (usually plural e.g. les informations: the news; une information: a piece of information)
inquiète: worried e.g. je suis inquiéte

column3: as far as e.g. j’ai marché jusqu’au restaurant: i walked up to the restaurant (but didn’t go in)

column1: les pâtes: pasta (feminine plural) # ignore translation error

column3: them e.g. c’est leur sac alors je leur ai donné le sac: it is their bag so I gave them the bag

column1: lien (m): link e.g. for a website
ligne (f): line e.g. une ligne de metro
livre (f): pound e.g. une livre de beurre: a pound of butter # ignore translation error
maigrir: to lose weight (opposite of grandir)

column2: work e.g. l’ordinateur ne marche pas

column4: comparative bon e.g. le meilleur: the best)

column1: mieux (m): better and best (usually with verb
column2: comparitive bien e.g. il écrit le mieux: he writes the best)
way e.g. le mode d’emploi: directions for use # ignore translation error
nobody e.g. je ne veux personne: I see nobody
give (something) e.g. Il lui offre un cadeau: he is giving her a present

column1: paire (f): pair e.g. une paire de baskets: a pair of sneakers

column3: while (for some time) e.g. j’ai cuisiné pendant une heure: I cooked for an hour

column1: penser: to think e.g. je pense à toi: I'm thinking of you

column2: afraid e.g. il a peur: he is afraid

column1: photographe: photographer (can be masculine or feminine)
physique (f): physics e.g. il est professeur de physique: he’s a physics teacher # ignore translation error

column3: place e.g. La place de la République
a lot of e.g. la rue est pleine de gens: the street is full of people

column1: plus: more e.g. les frères les plus vieux : the older brothers

column2: to (for the benefit of) e.g. je cuisine pour toi (not used for time
make e.g. j’ai préparé un repas (past participle: preparé)

column4: press e.g. elle est pressée: she's in a hurry

column3: exit e.g. Il a quitté sa petite amie: he left his girlfriend

column1: quoi: what (usually at end of sentence e.g. tu fais quoi?)

column4: can be masuline or feminine noun)

column2: miss e.g. j’ai raté mon bus: i missed my bus

column1: réceptionniste: receptionist (can be masculine or feminine)
ressembler: to look like e.g. elle ne ressemble pas à sa sœur: she doesn’t look like her sister.
réverbère (m): street lamp # ignore translation error
riche: rich (masuline and feminine; mpl: les riches
royaume-uni (m): United Kingdom # ignore translation error
s’intéresser: to take an interest in
salle (f): room (usually a specific type e.g. salle de bain)

column2: info or skills (to know how to do something)

column1: se asseoir: to sit down (order e.g. asseyez-vous
se coucher: to go to bed
se promener: to take a walk
se retourner: to turn around # ignore translation error
se souvenir: to remember e.g. je ne me souviens pas de son adresse: I can’t remember his address
seconde (f): second e.g. a second in time # ignore translation error
secrétaire: secretary (can be masculine and feminine)
station (f): station e.g. la station de metro
sushi (m): sushi e.g. les sushis est un plat japonais: sushi is a japanese dish

column2: telephone e.g. un telephone portable: a mobile phone
tienne: yours (singular) e.g. Est-il que je peux avoir le tien: can I have yours?
excursion e.g. un tour à vélo: a bike-ride # ignore translation error

column7: tous=everybody e.g. nous comprenons tout: we understand everything; nous vous comprenons tous: we understand you all)

column2: usually foot powered (though can be e-scooter!)

column1: végane: vegan (can be masculine or feminine) # ignore translation error

column2: way e.g. montrer la voie: to show the way

column1: y: there e.g. nous y sommes allés: we went there # ignore translation error
